title: Jean-Baptiste Fritzson
text:
Jean-Baptiste Fritzson (born 4 January 1986) is a <a href="Haiti">Haiti</a>an <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> player who currently plays as a <a href="Forward%20%28football%29">striker</a> for <a href="Morris%20Elite%20SC">Morris Elite SC</a>.
Career.
Born in <a href="Delmas%2C%20Ouest">Delmas</a>, <a href="Haiti">Haiti</a>, Jean-Baptiste Fritzson started his career with the youth setup of local club <a href="Aigle%20Noir%20AC">Aigle Noir AC</a>. After several years with the first team of <a href="Aigle%20Noir%20AC">Aigle Noir AC</a> in January 2009 he went on trial at <a href="Montreal%20Impact%20%281992-2011%29">Montreal Impact</a> and <a href="New%20York%20Red%20Bulls">New York Red Bulls</a>.
On May 17, 2010, the <a href="New%20England%20Revolution">New England Revolution</a> of <a href="Major%20League%20Soccer">Major League Soccer</a> announced that Fritzson would join the team on trial. He started for the team in a friendly match against <a href="S.L.%20Benfica">Benfica</a> on May 18, 2010.
For the 2011 season Fritzon played college soccer for <a href="Essex%20County%20College">Essex County College</a>. In his one year with the Wolverines he appeared in 6 matches scoring 9 goals and providing 2 assists.
On September 22, 2020, it was announced that Fritzon would be joining <a href="Morris%20Elite%20SC">Morris Elite SC</a> for the clubs inaugural season in <a href="USL%202">USL 2</a>.
International.
Fitzson is a former Haitian Under-21 International player having appeared in seven games and scoring one goal.In 2006 he played his first match with the senior national team. He also played with his country the Under 23 qualification matches for the Beijing Olympic Games.
